meanings.definition: Having or causing a sensation of spinning around and losing one's balance.
meanings.sent1: The carousel made me feel the dizziest I've ever been.
meanings.sent2: She spun around in circles until she felt the dizziest.
meanings.sent3: Trying to walk straight after the dizzy ride made me feel like a dizzy penguin.
meanings.sent4: The world seemed to spin faster, making everything around me the dizziest blur.
meanings.sent5: The room spun so fast that it felt like the dizziest tornado.

meanings.sent1: The complex puzzle left her feeling the dizziest she had ever felt.
meanings.sent2: After the unexpected news, he felt the dizziest he had ever felt.
meanings.sent3: The upside-down map made me feel like the dizziest explorer.
meanings.sent4: The twists and turns of the plot left me in the dizziest maze of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The conflicting instructions made my mind the dizziest jumble of thoughts.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lightheaded or unsteady feeling.
meanings.sent1: The high altitude made me feel the dizziest I've ever felt.
meanings.sent2: Standing up too quickly can make you feel the dizziest.
meanings.sent3: The dizzy height of the roller coaster made me feel like a dizzy astronaut.
meanings.sent4: The dizzy heights of success can sometimes make one feel the dizziest.
meanings.sent5: The dizzying speed of the spinning top made it the dizziest toy in the room.
